body:
@ispirmustafa `specificity` is not recall, nor anything else already in tensorflow. `sensitivity` is the same as recall. Changing the default name can be either by
```python
def sensitivity(..., name=None):
  return recall(..., name or "sensitivity")
```
or by
```python
def sensitivity(..., name="sensitivity"):
  return recall(..., name)
```
The difference between these two cases is the generated api doc. See:
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/metrics/recall
it has:
```python
tf.metrics.recall(
    labels,
    predictions,
    weights=None,
    metrics_collections=None,
    updates_collections=None,
    name=None
)
```
So I would prefer the first approach because having a  `name="sensitivity"` for sensitivity and a `name=None` for everything else seems to be confusing to users.
